author: Binay Curtis
title: The Elfenworks Foundation Honors HandUp, Moneythink, and Peace First with $75,000 and 2015 In Harmony with Hope™ Award
text:
The Elfenworks Foundation , an organization that works for hope in America by fostering creative and technology solutions that advance change, will honor three social entrepreneurs at the 9th annual In Harmony with Hope Awards at the Kohl Mansion in Burlingame, CA, on Thursday, October 1, 2015, at 6:30 p.m. This year’s recipients are promoting conflict resolution and collaborative change among youth, providing mentor-driven financial literacy training to low-income youth, and re-integrating homeless individuals into society. The Elfenworks Foundation will present a total of $75,000 to these three social entrepreneurs who are writing new stories of hope and harnessing the power of technology to create change: Rose Broome, Co-founder and CEO, HandUp ; Eric Dawson, Co-founder and President, Peace First ; and Ted Gonder, Co-founder and CEO, Moneythink . This year features a special guest Master of Ceremonies, acclaimed actor Elijah Kelley. He is known for his work in The Butler, Red Tails, and Hairspray and will be starring in NBC's production of The Wiz Live!
In reflecting on the powerful example of the 2015 In Harmony with Hope honorees, Elfenworks founder and CEO, Dr. Lauren Speeth, reminds us, “In big and small ways, each of us can take scary elements of dissonance and despair and weave new stories, stories that are in harmony with hope. Like the inspiring visionaries we’re honoring this year, each of us can change the story.” Through sharing the honorees’ narratives of change, Elfenworks sends a message that each of us can make a valuable impact on today’s society.
For the fifth year in a row, Wells Fargo has committed to supporting the awards program with a generous $10,000 contribution. Beyond the financial award that is given to honorees, the event also provides an opportunity for an exciting exchange of ideas when past and current honorees meet and discuss a shared vision for a better America.
The In Harmony with Hope Award was created to accelerate and celebrate the success of social entrepreneurs who are working to bring compassionate vision into action. The list of alumni honorees includes visionaries like Rosalynn Carter and Dr. Paul Farmer. Over the past nine years, Elfenworks, through the In Harmony with Hope Award, has awarded $675,000 to 27 social entrepreneurs who are working to create sustainable change in America.
Each changemaker expressed his/her gratitude for the In Harmony with Hope Award:
“HandUp leverages technology and the power of human connection to help those struggling with homelessness to move out of poverty,” said Rose Broome, Co-founder and CEO of HandUp. “These human connections re-ignite hope in people who are often at the lowest points of their lives. The In Harmony with Hope Award exposes the transformational role technology can play in connecting our communities and filling resource gaps through the power of the crowd.”
Ted Gonder, Co-founder and CEO of Moneythink, stated: "Moneythink believes in the power of human potential. Our volunteers work tirelessly to ensure low-income high school students graduate with the skills they need to navigate the financial challenges of adulthood. The In Harmony with Hope Award reflects our volunteers’ dedication, passion, and commitment to ensuring that all youth are able to achieve their full potential and we are honored to accept the award on their behalf.”
Eric Dawson, Co-founder and President of Peace First added: “I am tremendously honored to accept the In Harmony with Hope Award. For more than 20 years, Peace First has aimed to inspire a generation of youth peacemakers and instill a sense of courage, compassion, and collaboration in young people across the country. This award recognizes what we have achieved so far and the peacemaking movement that we continue to grow. We’re thrilled Elfenworks finds our work timely and essential.”
To RSVP to the 2015 In Harmony with Hope awards ceremony, visit http://www.IHH2015.eventbrite.com or call 650-347-9700 for information.
About Elfenworks “In Harmony with Hope”: Elfenworks works for hope in America by fostering creative and technology solutions that advance change. Elfenworks identifies chasms, creates change, and amplifies success, whether cultivating thousands of student social justice filmmakers in partnership with Campus MovieFest, promoting peace initiatives, assisting nonprofits safely navigate IT security, or helping people cope with stress through the Breathing Butterfly project. Visit http://www.elfenworks.org/ripple for big and small ways to make a difference.
